title: Molten Chocolate Cakes with Sugar-Coated Raspberries

Ingredients.2: 8 ounces semisweet chocolate chips, or bars, cut into bite-size chunks

Ingredients.6: 4 teaspoons flour (or matzo meal, ground in a blender to a fine powder)

Ingredients.9: 1 (6 ounce) container raspberries, rinsed and drained

Ingredients.10: 0.5 cup white sugar, or as needed

Directions.1: Melt butter and chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water; remove from heat. Beat eggs, sugar, and salt with a hand mixer in a medium bowl until sugar dissolves. Beat egg mixture into chocolate until smooth. Beat in flour until just combined. (Batter can be made a day ahead; return to room temperature an hour or so before baking.)

Directions.2: Adjust the oven rack to the middle position; preheat the oven to 450 degrees (230 degrees C).

Directions.3: Line a standard-size muffin tin (1/2 cup capacity) with 8 extra-large muffin papers (papers should extend above cups to facilitate removal). Spray muffin papers with cooking spray. Divide batter among muffin cups.

Directions.4: Bake until batter puffs but the center is not set, 8 to 10 minutes. Carefully lift cakes from the tin and set on a work surface. Pull papers away from cakes and transfer cakes to dessert plates.

Directions.5: Make garnish: Roll slightly dampened raspberries in sugar.

Directions.6: Top each cake with sugared raspberries and serve immediately.
